meanings.sent1: The warden decided to parole the inmate early.
meanings.sent2: The judge paroled the offender after serving half of the sentence.
meanings.sent3: The guard joked that he would parole the prisoner if he promised to behave.
meanings.sent4: The idea of freedom after being paroled felt like a dream come true.
meanings.sent5: The prisoner's face lit up when he heard he would be paroled soon.

meanings.definition: To grant a prisoner a parole.
meanings.sent1: The parole board will meet to decide if the convict should be paroled.
meanings.sent2: The governor has the authority to parole certain inmates.
meanings.sent3: The prisoner tried to convince the parole officer to let him be paroled early.
meanings.sent4: Being paroled means a chance to start fresh and make better choices.
meanings.sent5: The parole hearing was the prisoner's last hope for being paroled.
